docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Jan. 14--President Getulio Vargas will inaugurate tomorrow the PanAmerican Permanent Neutrality Committee to sit here for the duration of the war in Europe.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Jan. 14--President Getulio Vargas will inaugurate tomorrow the PanAmerican Permanent Neutrality Committee to sit here for the duration of the war in Europe.
docs.abstract: com sessions to begin; Uruguay proposes uniform regulations on belligerent submarines in Amer ports; Amb Sir G Knox says Brit will sympathize with but not approve of zone

headline.main: American Nations' Neutrality Board Begins Permanent Sessions at Rio de Janeiro Today

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON, Tuesday, Jan. 16--In plain but polite and friendly language, the British Government rejected today the proposal contained in the Declaration of Panama, in which the twenty-one American republics undertook to establish a neutrality belt...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Tuesday, Jan. 16--In plain but polite and friendly language, the British Government rejected today the proposal contained in the Declaration of Panama, in which the twenty-one American republics undertook to establish a neutrality belt extending an average of 300 miles from the coasts.
docs.abstract: Gt Brit rejects zone proposal in reply to note; text; study of reply likely at conf

headline.main: BRITAIN REJECTS SEA SAFETY ZONE; Reply to American Nations' Protest on Spee Battle Cites Belligerents' 'Rights'

byline.original: By RAYMOND DANIELL Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Jan. 15--Opening the first session of the Inter-American Neutrality Committee here today, President Getulio Yargas of Brazil declared that the Americas had as much right to proclaim a peace zone as European nations had to...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Jan. 15--Opening the first session of the Inter-American Neutrality Committee here today, President Getulio Yargas of Brazil declared that the Americas had as much right to proclaim a peace zone as European nations had to proclaim a war zone.
docs.abstract: com sessions open; Pres G Vargas holds zone is right of Amer nations; Dr A de Mello Franco elected permanent chmn; 4 questions by Uruguay on belligerent warships rept

headline.main: SAFETY ZONE HELD RIGHT OF AMERICAS; Vargas Tells Neutrality Body Belligerents Must Respect Our Sea Trade Rights URUGUAY POSESQUESTIONS Wants to Know When a Ship Is a Naval Auxiliary and How It Should Be Treated

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON, Jan. 16--Great Britain added to her growing list of "dead or missing" in the war the names of about 130 men, most of them in their twenties, who went out in three submarines on "particularly hazardous" missions one night last ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Jan. 16--Great Britain added to her growing list of "dead or missing" in the war the names of about 130 men, most of them in their twenties, who went out in three submarines on "particularly hazardous" missions one night last ...

headline.main: UNDERSEAS CRAFT SUNK, SAYS BERLIN; Reports Two of British Ships Destroyed at Helgoland-- Allies Claim 3 U-Boats
